author: timesunion.com
title: Rodger's Quick Take
text: I am sure Jimmer Fredette is not giving up on his NBA career despite being released by the San Antonio Spurs . And he shouldn't give up hope that some team will figure out how to best utilize his talents. But in the meantime, Fredette might want to consider going overseas. He could easily play on a top-level team, be the star, and make good money. Fredette might not have any desire, but it's something to consider especially after playing with four different NBA team in four years â€” and not getting a whole lot of playing time. A couple of years overseas could pave his way back into the NBA. Just a thought for a player whose work ethic in second to none. NewsChannel 13's Rodger Wyland can be heard weekdays from 9 a.m. to noon on WOFX 980 AM.
